metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2394 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.13 and 1.6.x before 1.6.8 on the SPARC andItanium platforms does not properly perform data alignment for a certainstructure member, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (application crash) via a (1) ICMP or (2) ICMPv6 Echo Requestpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.6.8-1
libwireshark11 - 1.6.8-1
libwiretap8 - 1.6.8-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.6.8-1
libwsutil9 - 1.6.8-1
tshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 1.6.8-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1').
